problem_set.title: Apply algebraic methods in solving problems
problem_set.instructions: Show all working. Calculators are not permitted.

parts.text: Find the value of 4 - 3(5x²yz³ + yz) when x = 2, y = -2, z = 1
Find the value of 4 - 3(5x²yz³ + yz) when x = 2, y = 1, z = -1
Find the value of the formula T = 2π√(m/k), where m = 2, k = 100. Round your answer to 3 d.p.
Find the value of the formula B = (1/L)√(mgR tan(x)/(v cos(x))), where L = 1, m = 0.2, g = 9.81, R = 0.5, v = 2 and x = 15°. Round your answer to 3 d.p.

In the following figure, b is a constant. Find length x in terms of b. The two thick lines are parallel to each other.

Find an equation for m, in terms of n: 9 × 3^(m-n) = 81^(2m)
p is a real number and n is a whole number, 5(p²)^n × 3p³ = 15p¹⁵. What is the value of n?
parts.answer: n = 6 if p ≠ 0, ±1; n can be any real number if p = 0 or ±1

topics.title: Solve linear equations and system of linear equations with two unknowns

parts.text: Find x. The two thick lines are parallel to each other

Solve for x, y in the following linear system: 3x + 2y = 56, 2x + 3y = 44
The Rectangle A has a perimeter of 70 cm and B has a perimeter of 64 cm. Find the length and width of each rectangle.
parts.answer: Rectangle A: length = 20 cm, width = 15 cm; Rectangle B: length = 20 cm, width = 12 cm

parts.text: 4³ × 4^(x-5) > 2200; x is an integer

topics.title: Miscellaneous word problems - Application of the above theories

parts.text: Cost of marmalade: C = b + an. Cost for 185 cans is $985, for 210 cans is $1085. Find cost for 300 cans.
Tom spent $560: groceries = 7×(mobile data/internet), rent = groceries + $80, transport = $30. Find mobile data/internet cost.
Golf ball trajectory: h = -(1/500)x² + 0.2x. Find x where ball reaches maximum height.
Profit formula: P = -10x² + 30x + 400. Find x that ensures P > 0 and find x that maximizes P.
parts.answer: -5 < x < 8 ensures P > 0; x = $1.5 maximizes P

metadata.source: NCEA Level 1 Practice Problem Set for Standard 91947
metadata.notes: Comprehensive problem set covering all aspects of algebraic methods. Includes basic through advanced problems with full worked solutions. Problems marked with * are more challenging.
